security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution. It only provides documentation and triggers for using external MCP tools (claude-mem) that users configure themselves. No scripts, network calls, or file system access detected in this skill.

content.user_title: Share Memory Between Claude Code and Cursor
content.value_statement: Claude Code and Cursor cannot share session memory. This skill integrates claude-mem MCP server to search past decisions and record new observations across both tools.
actual_capabilities: Search past decisions and observations using MCP tools
Record design decisions and patterns with tags
Access shared SQLite memory database between tools
Create entities and relations for knowledge graph
Enable seamless handoff between Cursor and Claude Code
limitations: Requires separate claude-mem MCP server installation
Does not load for regular coding tasks
First search takes 2-3 seconds for worker startup

use_cases.title: Record Design Decisions
use_cases.description: Document architecture choices and design rationale for implementation teams to reference later.

use_cases.title: Search Past Solutions
use_cases.description: Find previously solved problems and patterns before starting new implementations.

use_cases.title: Handoff Between Tools
use_cases.description: Record context in Cursor for Claude Code to continue work seamlessly across sessions.

output: Reason: RLS integration, simplified session management, scalability

best_practices: Record the 'why' not just the 'what' - focus on rationale behind decisions
Use consistent tags like 'source:cursor' or 'source:claude-code' for filtering
Link related files and observations for easier future discovery
anti_patterns: Recording temporary notes as permanent observations
Using inconsistent tags that make search difficult
Forgetting to add context or rationale to recorded decisions

faq.question: Does this work with Claude Code app?
faq.answer: Yes. Both Cursor and Claude Code share the same SQLite database at ~/.claude-mem/claude-mem.db.

faq.question: How many memories can I store?
faq.answer: claude-mem uses SQLite with no hard limit. Storage depends on your disk space.

faq.question: Can I use this without MCP server?
faq.answer: No. This skill requires claude-mem MCP server installed separately. See setup guide in SKILL.md.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All data stays local in ~/.claude-mem/claude-mem.db. No network calls are made.

faq.question: Why are MCP tools not appearing?
faq.answer: Check .cursor/mcp.json path is absolute, script is executable, and Cursor has been restarted.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude Code memory?
faq.answer: claude-mem provides persistent cross-tool memory. Both tools access the same shared database.
